Literature Review: The following 10 studies are selected based on their relevance to the research topic 'A Systems Approach to Understanding How Plants Transformed Earth's Environment in Deep Time' with a focus on plant functional traits, plant functional strategies, ecosystem modeling, Earth system modeling, vegetation-climate interactions, and the late Paleozoic period.

References.authors: David J. Beerling, Colin P. Osborne, Peter J. Franks
References.title: Evolution of leaf-form in land plants linked to atmospheric CO2 decline in the Late Palaeozoic era

References.authors: Jennifer C. McElwain, William G. Chaloner
References.title: The effect of experimental CO2 enrichment on stomatal density and leaf gas exchange of a late Palaeozoic fern ally

References.authors: Christopher J. Poulsen, Jeffrey T. Kiehl, Christine A. Shields
References.title: Impact of terrestrial vegetation on climate during the late Paleozoic

References.authors: Christopher M. Berry, William G. Chaloner, Jennifer C. McElwain
References.title: The impact of the evolution of plants on the Earth system

References.authors: Jennifer C. McElwain, William G. Chaloner, Christopher M. Berry
References.title: The impact of the evolution of plants on the Earth system: A review

References.title: Impact of terrestrial vegetation on climate during the late Paleozoic
